intro: Gymnadenia conopsea f. comigera, commonly known as the Comigera orchid, is a rare and distinctive orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect flowering stems that bear clusters of pale pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in calcareous grasslands and open woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its botanical features include elongated, strap-like leaves and a unique floral structure that facilitates pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
